justification: “Ratcliff and McKoon (2018) conducted a study where participants were tasked with determining whether there were more blue or yellow dots in an array (i.e., the blue/yellow dot task).” This task operationalises judgments about the relative quantity of two item types.

“Participants saw a series of depictions of popcorn bags… They were asked to determine which flavor made up the majority of the kernels in each bag.” The majority-identification task serves as the measure of perceived quantity ratios.
“Participants saw two illustrated bags of popcorn shown side-by-side and were asked to indicate which bag they preferred.” Selecting a bag functions as the measure of preference.
“Participants viewed photographs of two flower bouquets… and their task was to identify the more expensive bouquet.” This price-judgment task operationalises perceived value.
